statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Avery Ugba and Remond Brown each scored 21 points and Grambling State beat Alabama State 82-69 on Thursday night to keep pace with Jackson State and Prairie View A&M in the Southwestern Athletic
article.headline: Grambling State cruises to 82-69 win over Alabama State
article.linkText: Grambling State cruises to 82-69 win over Alabama State
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Avery Ugba and Remond Brown each scored 21 points and Grambling State beat Alabama State 82-69 on Thursday night to keep pace with Jackson State and Prairie View A&M in the Southwestern Athletic Conference standings. The Tigers (14-16, 9-8) are tied with Jackson State and Prairie View for fourth with one game remaining, with the top-four seeds earning first round home games in the conference tournament. Ervin Mitchell added 19 points for Grambling, which shot 55.8 percent from the field and 60 percent from long range. Grambling opened on an 11-0 run and built a 42-27 lead at the break. A Brown jumper with 15:57 left made it 52-32 Tigers. Alabama State rallied to within six with 6:20 left, but an 8-0 Grambling run pushed the score back out of reach. Corvon Butler and Reginald Gee scored 19 points apiece for the Hornets (8-21, 6-11).
